Security threats and vulnerabilities in virtualized systems
Data security
Due to the multi - tenant nature of virtualization ,
the data you store on one VM Wars Can
possibly be stolen by a process in another VM.
The UM-to- VM communication never actually
reaches the physical server and is thus ,
difficult to detect by administration who
typically deals with network security.
Threat to hypervisor
Hypervisor creates and manages all the VMS on
a physical server. Therefore it acts as a
X
O
single point of failure . If hypervisor is compromised.
all VMs and the complete physical server is
compromised . This can be avoided by timely
O
security updates of hypervisor along with VM
isolation .
Threat to VMS
A VM running
malicious programs may result
in information compromise of another VM.
This can be reduced using VM- isplation and
VM - hardening.
Threat to OS
Apart from hypervisor & VM, the operating system
Scanned with CamScanner
